clips.label: Microwave Sparks Explained
clips.text: Why your microwave is sparking & how to stop it.

srt_stub.text: Don’t panic – here’s why it happens…
Common causes: metal objects, paint damage, or worn parts.
Ignoring sparks can lead to bigger problems or even fire.
Let’s look at the most common issues and easy fixes.

clips.label: Fix Paint Damage
clips.text: Repair chipped paint inside your microwave safely.

srt_stub.text: Chipped paint can expose metal and cause arcing.
Sand it down, clean, and apply microwave-safe touch-up paint.
This prevents sparks and restores the cavity safely.

clips.label: Waveguide Cover Fix
clips.text: How to replace a burnt or cracked waveguide cover.

srt_stub.text: A burnt waveguide cover can cause sparking.
If you see burn marks, remove and replace the cover.
Pop out the tabs, slide in the new one, and snap it in place.
Quick, safe, and your microwave is protected again.

clips.label: Rack Support Fix
clips.text: Loose rack supports can cause sparks – here’s the fix.

srt_stub.text: Wire rack supports can loosen, crack, or fall out.
That loose contact causes arcing when the microwave runs.
Replace supports easily – they just push into place.

clips.label: Final Fixes & Wrap-Up
clips.text: Other causes: grease, faulty stirrer fan – replace if damaged.

srt_stub.text: Food and grease buildup can carbonize and spark.
A faulty stirrer fan can overheat one spot and cause arcing.
Replace damaged fans or blades for safe operation.
